trans-unit.source: An embedded environment is an environment in which only a single application can access a database at one time, and no network access occurs.

seg-source.mrk: An embedded environment is an environment in which only a single application can access a database at one time, and no network access occurs.

target.mrk: An embedded environment is an environment in which only a single application can access a database at one time, and no network access occurs.

trans-unit.source: When an application starts an instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within its JVM, the application runs in an embedded environment. Loading the embedded driver starts <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: When an application starts an instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within its JVM, the application runs in an embedded environment.

target.mrk: When an application starts an instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within its JVM, the application runs in an embedded environment.
